p: The spectral region at 2800–3000 cm −1 can be resolved into five discrete bands: CH stretching (2897 cm −1), symmetric CH 2 stretching (2857 cm −1), CH 2 asymmetric stretching (2925 cm −1), CH 3 symmetric stretching (2872 cm −1), and CH 3 asymmetric stretching (2962 cm −1). The broad absorbance band between 3000 and 3100 cm −1 region is assigned to aromatic C–H stretching and used to compute Aromaticity. CH 3/CH 2 ratio are computed from the ratio of integrated peak areas arising from 2957 and 2925 cm −1, respectively, i.e., A 2957/A 2925.
